reviews.title: cosy place in the middle of no-where!
reviews.text: Lovely place to eat and drink tho very pricey. Excellent food and good portions which are well presented. The smell of the burning fire adds to the atmosphere which is of a rustic appearance.
Food overpriced ,portions meagre,breakfast defies description , bacon that hard should be on the MOD shopping list.
reviews.title: expensive

reviews.text: Not a beer house pipes not cleaned, only saving grace decent pub acrosss the road.
reviews.title: A great, simple, place to stay.. eat.. drink and sleep!

reviews.text: Rooms clean no dressingtable cannot see how it reached AA standard.
reviews.title: Eat, Sleep, Drink at Felin Fach Griffen

reviews.text: Hands and knees job to dy hair.
reviews.title: The food is excellent but...

reviews.text: My finacee and I have just returned from a two night stay in the Felin Fach Griffin, very relaxed and in the mind of "we'll be back"
reviews.title: Amazing food, service a little too relaxed?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't check in until 6.30 in the evening as we'd spent the day walking in the Beacons. First impressions were better than expected - the picture on the website doesn't really do it justice. Warm welcome at reception, especially for our dog. We stayed in Room 1. Fourposter bed (although the mattress was rock hard). Nice views over the fields. Lovely bathroom, great shower, huge towels, White Company Bath and Shower products. We had been left a dog towel and dog bowls for water which is great when you're travelling with your dog.
reviews.title: Great place

likes.liked: — dog friendly, great food, perfect location for walking in wales

reviews.text: They had reserved a table in the Bar for us as dogs aren't allowed in the proper restaurant, but this was perfect for our tastes. Huge roaring fire, plenty of atmosphere and dog was so tired from the walking she just fell asleep on the floor.
reviews.title: Good Food
Loved it, rustic charm at its best.
reviews.text: The food was very good. Lots of local produce featuring on the menu which is very good - Welsh lamb obviously, locally smoked salmon and black pudding, local organic in season vegetables. The chocolate tart and home made ice cream is just to die for.
They had some nice wines on the wine list, although they'd run out of our first choice.
reviews.title: Nice country pu with rooms

likes.liked: — Nice cosy atmosphere - great in the winter

reviews.title: Great food, terrible service
reviews.text: Breakfast is at a huge table in front of the Aga. Get there early enough to get the soda bread and toast it on the Aga. Fresh coffee, orange juice, cereals and of course a full english breakfast if you want it. The breakfast was very good, proper sausages and bacon (none of that watery plastic wrapped stuff you get in supermarkets) a choice of chicken or duck eggs and local black pudding. Just right to set you up for another day of walking.
